intro: Ferulago pachyloba, commonly known as the thick-leaved ferulago, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as scrublands and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal gardens.
